title: B-Cell depletion by anti-CD20 in renal allograft recipients who develop de novo anti-HLA alloantibodies

producedBy.name: B-Cell depletion by anti-CD20 in renal allograft recipients who develop de novo anti-HLA alloantibodies

values: Screening - Subject and/or parent guardian must be able to understand and provide informed consent and/or assent
Screening - No known history of non-adherence to prescribed regimens
Screening - Male or Female, 5-70 years of age
Screening - Diagnosed with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD)
Screening - Renal transplant recipient, 3-36 months post renal transplantation
Screening - No known contraindications to therapy using Rituximab
Screening - Female subjects must agree to refrain from breast-feeding a child during study participation
Screening - Female and male subjects with reproductive potential must agree to use FDA approved methods of birth control during study participation
Screening - Pediatrics (less than 18 years of age) must have all childhood vaccinations up to date for age, as medically indicated
Screening - Recipients of kidneys from donors > 70 years of age
Screening - Multi-organ transplant
Screening - Prior history of organ transplantation (other than kidney transplantation)
Screening - Previous treatment with Rituximab (MabThera / Rituxan)
Screening - History of severe allergic anaphylactic reactions to humanized or murine monoclonal antibodies
Screening - Lack of IV venous access
Screening - Sensitized to greater than 5% Panel Reactive Antibody (PRA) within 12 weeks prior to transplant
Screening - History of recurrent significant infection or history of recurrent bacterial infections
Screening - Serologic positivity to HIV, HBsAg, HBc Ab, or HCV Ab
Screening - History of drug, alcohol, or chemical abuse within 6 months prior to enrollment
Screening - History of malignancy except adequately treated in-situ cervical carcinoma, or adequately treated basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
Screening - Clinically significant cardiovascular or pulmonary disease
Screening - Evidence of urinary tract obstruction causing decreased renal function, unless corrected by time of enrollment

Screening - Any other disease, metabolic dysfunction, physical examination finding, or clinical laboratory finding giving reasonable suspicion of a disease or condition that contraindicates the use of an investigational drug or that may affect the interpretation of the results or render the patient at high risk from treatment complications
Screening - History of psychiatric disorder that would interfere with normal participation in this study
Screening - Inability or unwillingness of subject and/or parent guardian to provide informed consent or comply with the study protocol
Screening - Use of other investigational drugs within 4 weeks of participation
Screening - Recent recipient of any licensed or investigational live attenuated vaccine(s) within two months of enrollment and for the duration of the study

Pilot - Living and deceased-donor renal transplant recipients who have developed de novo anti-HLA antibodies (Luminex platform with One Lambda?s LabScreen PRA Class I and II kit) measured on two occasions within the enrollment window (3 to 36 months post-transplantation)
Pilot - Recipients who are 3 months but not greater than 39 months post-transplant
Pilot - Female subjects of childbearing potential must have a negative serum pregnancy test prior to enrollment in the pilot study
Pilot - Female and male subjects with reproductive potential must agree to use FDA approved methods of birth control during study participation, and for 12 months following study therapy
Pilot - Previous treatment with Rituximab (MabThera / Rituxan)
Pilot - Immunoglobulin levels <500mg/dL (Combined IgM, IgG, IgA, IgE, IgD)
Pilot - History of severe allergic anaphylactic reactions to humanized or murine monoclonal antibodies
Pilot - Lack of IV venous access
Pilot - Active systemic infection at time of enrollment in the pilot study

Pilot - Recipients demonstrating recurrent or de novo glomerular disease or Banff Grade III chronic rejection, other than chronic humoral rejection (CHR), in the renal transplant baseline biopsy will be excluded from the study
Pilot - History of malignancy except adequately treated in-situ cervical carcinoma, or adequately treated basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
Pilot - History of Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder (PTLD)
Pilot - Serum creatinine of >=3.0 mg/dl or calculated Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) <25 mL/minute (normalized to 1.73 m2 for subjects <=18 years of age) at time of enrollment in the pilot study
Pilot - Pediatric subjects (less than 18) who test positive test for Parvovirus (B19) by PCR in the blood

Pilot - Known active bacterial, viral, fungal, mycobacterial, or other infection (including tuberculosis or atypical mycobacterial disease, but excluding fungal infections of nail beds) or any major episode of infection requiring hospitalization or treatment with intravenous antibiotics within 4 weeks of enrollment in the pilot study
Pilot - Current hemoglobin < 8.5gm/dL, platelets <80,000/mm, white blood cell count <3000 /mm3 within 4 weeks prior to enrollment, subject may be enrolled once the parameter is corrected
Pilot - Absolute neutrophil count of <1000/mm3
Pilot - Elevation of liver function tests at time of enrollment in the pilot study (AST and/or ALT >2.5 times the upper limit of normal)
Pilot - Female subjects presently breast-feeding a child

creators.name: NOVEL THERAPIES OF CHRONIC ALLOGRAFT DYSFUNCTION (CTOT-02)

availability: Available for download after registration with ImmPort

distributions.title: B-Cell depletion by anti-CD20 in renal allograft recipients who develop de novo anti-HLA alloantibodies

acknowledges.name: NOVEL THERAPIES OF CHRONIC ALLOGRAFT DYSFUNCTION (CTOT-02)

description: The purpose of this study is to determine whether treatment with rituximab (anti-CD20, Rituxan, MabThera) in individuals who develop new anti-HLA antibodies after renal (kidney) transplant will promote longer-term survival of the transplanted kidney. The pilot study compares the use of rituximab (Rituxan) + site-specific standard immunosuppression to placebo + site-specific standard immunosuppression in the treatment of circulating anti-HLA antibodies in subjects who develop de novo anti-HLA antibodies between 3-36 months after transplant.
